content.twitter:
Claude Code's context window used to drive me crazy.

I'd be deep in a debugging session, hit the limit, and watch it forget everything we'd just figured out together.

My workaround? I built a whole system of sub-agents. Delegated tasks to them. Kept the main context clean.

Felt clever at the time.

Then the latest releases dropped and... Claude Code just does this automatically now.

It manages its own context. Delegates internally. Keeps track of what matters.

3 weeks of my architecture work, obsolete in one update.

Honestly? Not even mad. Sessions run smoother. Less babysitting. More actual coding.

Anyone else notice the context handling got way better recently, or was I just doing it wrong before?
